p: For clarity, Figure 1 shows only the seven most representative phyla. These are complemented with the phyla Synergistetes, Verrucomicrobia, and Deinococcus-Thermus that are present in a very low proportion in one single mouse under SD in the first case and under the ROO diet in the other two. After analyzing the distributions using Kruskalâ€“Wallis test, only the phylum Tenericutes showed statistically significant differences ( p = 0.023), with a pairwise comparison rending adjusted signification only between the standard and ROO groups ( p = 0.013; Figure 2). When a regression fit was performed, Tenericutes showed positive correlation with total cholesterol ( R 2 = 0.12; p = 0.041) and diuresis ( R 2 = 0.40; p = 0.030).
